intro: Chamaesyce hirta var. laeticincta, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features small, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces tiny greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it identifiable within the genus Chamaesyce, which belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae.
